page.title: 08A MILL DEVELOPS AT EGMERE
page.content: War over, the R.A.F. base was con- verted to a{grass drying plant}to produce much needed{protein.}It was later bought by the late Lord Melchett and became known as{British Field {Products Ltd.}A finance company - Samuels Merchant Bankers - became involved and the company expanded. Gaining the assets of a small Animal Feeds and Grain Merchants Company at North Elmham known as R.J.Seaman, it was decided to produce animal feeds at B.F.P. and a small pilot plant was installed. The company was taken over by the present owners, Guardian Royal Exchange, and the site name changed to {R.J.Seaman and Sons Ltd.}The mill was enlarged in 1968 and grass drying ceased in the late 70s. In 1980 a new, fully computerised mill was built and in 1981 the original mill was enlarged.
